comments:
Steps to reproduce:
Create Model A
Create My.ecore
Create package model
Create subpackege somepackage
Create class Class1 in somepackage
Create class Class2 in somepackage
Create reference in Class1 of a type Class2

Open new EMF Model wizard for ecore 
Load My.ecore


And now on the next page, there is model package shown and selected but the Finish button is disabled and in Error Log view I can see:
org.eclipse.swt.SWTException: Failed to execute runnable (java.lang.NullPointerException)
	at org.eclipse.swt.SWT.error(SWT.java:3374)

Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.emf.converter.util.ConverterUtil.computeRequiredPackages(ConverterUtil.java:392)
	at org.eclipse.emf.converter.ui.contribution.base.ModelConverterPackagePage.validate(ModelConverterPackagePage.java:829)

	at org.eclipse.emf.converter.ui.contribution.base.ModelConverterPackagePage$1.run(ModelConverterPackagePage.java:147)

But when I click Back button and Next button again then Finish button is enabled and genmodel can be generated without any further problems.

The problem is happening because you need to set the NSURI each package.  Creating an Ecore model directly using the Ecore Sample Editor requires a deeper knowledge of what are the required information of the different model elements.  NSURI and NSPrefix on packages and the name of all elements are examples of required attributes.

In EMF 2.3.0 we've implement the bugzilla 75933.  We've also changed the EMF Model wizard for ecore to invoke these validations so you would see these problems immediately.
